Entry.JapaneseText: 確かに身体は心の器でしかないさ。 でもおれは、器も大事だって思うんだ。
Entry.EnglishText: Truly, the body is nothing more than a vessel for the heart. But, I think that the vessel is also important.

Entry.JapaneseText: 料理にだって、それぞれに合う皿がある。
Entry.EnglishText: For every meal, there is a plate that goes along with it.

Entry.JapaneseText: 料理の中身や味も大切だけど、 皿だってないがしろにできない。だろ？
Entry.EnglishText: The ingredients and flavor are important to food, but you can't ignore the plate that it's on. Right?

Entry.JapaneseText: 心と身体、両方そろって 初めて<Yellow>ヒト<White>って事さ。違うか？
Entry.EnglishText: So it's only when the heart and body are together that you have the makings of a <Yellow>Human<White> being. Am I wrong?
